metadata.filter_applied: Only courses with full text content (no video OR video with transcripts)

courses.title: Machine Learning
courses.description: Introductory graduate course on machine learning covering classification, linear regression, boosting, support vector machines, hidden Markov models, and Bayesian networks.

courses.title: Mathematics of Machine Learning
courses.description: Mathematically rigorous introduction to machine learning with emphasis on methods and their analysis. Topics include supervised learning, empirical risk minimization, and statistical learning theory.

courses.title: Advanced Natural Language Processing
courses.description: Graduate introduction to natural language processing covering syntactic, semantic, and discourse processing models. Emphasizes machine learning approaches including HMMs, PCFGs, and EM algorithm.

courses.title: Natural Language and the Computer Representation of Knowledge
courses.description: Laboratory-oriented course on the theory and practice of building computer systems for human language processing, with emphasis on linguistic, cognitive, and engineering foundations.

courses.title: Structure and Interpretation of Computer Programs
courses.description: Introduction to programming and computational modeling. Covers techniques to control complexity in large systems, building abstractions with procedures and data, state, and the environment model of evaluation.

courses.title: Mathematics for Computer Science
courses.description: Elementary discrete mathematics for computer science and engineering: logic, proofs, induction, number theory, probability, counting.

courses.title: Computer System Engineering
courses.description: Topics on the engineering of computer software and hardware systems: techniques for controlling complexity; strong modularity using client-server design, operating systems; performance, networks; naming; security and privacy; fault-tolerant systems, atomicity and coordination of concurrent activities, and recovery; impact of computer systems on society.

courses.title: Operating System Engineering
courses.description: Fundamental design and implementation of operating systems. Topics include virtual memory, file systems, threads, context switches, kernels, interrupts, system calls, interprocess communication, coordination, and the interaction between software and hardware.

courses.title: Distributed Computer Systems Engineering
courses.description: Abstractions and implementation techniques for engineering distributed systems: remote procedure call, threads and locking, client/server, peer-to-peer, consistency, fault tolerance, and security.

courses.title: Linear Algebra
courses.description: Basic subject on matrix theory and linear algebra. Emphasis on topics useful in other disciplines: systems of equations, vector spaces, determinants, eigenvalues, similarity, and positive definite matrices.

courses.title: Linear Algebra
courses.description: Scholar course version of Linear Algebra designed for independent study. Covers systems of linear equations and the properties of matrices, essential for physics, economics, and engineering.

courses.title: Single Variable Calculus
courses.description: Differentiation and integration of functions of one variable. Applications to geometry, physics, and elementary differential equations.

courses.title: Introduction to Probability and Statistics
courses.description: Elementary introduction to probability and statistics with applications. Basic probability models, combinatorics, random variables, discrete and continuous probability distributions, statistical estimation and testing.

courses.title: Learn Differential Equations: Up Close with Gilbert Strang and Cleve Moler
courses.description: Gilbert Strang explains differential equations and linear algebra, crucial subjects in science and engineering. Includes MATLAB demonstrations by Cleve Moler.

courses.title: Physics I: Classical Mechanics
courses.description: Newton's laws, motion, energy and momentum, rotation, gravitation, oscillations, waves. Physical intuition developed through problem solving and demonstrations.

courses.title: Statistical Physics I
courses.description: Introduction to probability, statistical mechanics, and thermodynamics. Random variables, joint and conditional probability, and the Boltzmann distribution.

courses.title: Statistical Mechanics I: Statistical Mechanics of Particles
courses.description: Covers thermodynamics and classical statistical mechanics. Topics include probability theory, microcanonical and canonical ensembles, and quantum statistical mechanics.

courses.title: Genetics
courses.description: Principles of genetics with application to studying biological function at the level of molecules, cells, and multicellular organisms, including humans.

courses.title: Organic Chemistry I
courses.description: Introduction to organic chemistry, including structure and bonding, acidity, functional groups, stereochemistry, and reactions of organic molecules.

courses.title: Introduction to Psychology
courses.description: Survey of the scientific study of human nature: how the mind works and how the brain supports it. Topics include perception, emotion, learning, memory, cognition, child development, personality, and social interaction.

courses.title: Experimental Molecular Neurobiology
courses.description: Basic experimental techniques in cellular and molecular neurobiology: tissue culture, DNA manipulation, synaptic protein analysis, immunocytochemistry, and fluorescent microscopy.

courses.title: Human Memory and Learning
courses.description: Surveys cognitive and neural organization of human memory and learning: working memory, episodic and semantic memory, and implicit forms of memory.

courses.title: Sensation and Perception
courses.description: Introduction to perception and the neural basis of sensory processing. Topics include visual, auditory, and somatosensory systems.

courses.title: Mechanics and Materials I
courses.description: Introduction to statics and strength of materials. Application of equilibrium principles to structural systems and mechanisms.

courses.title: Modeling Dynamics and Control II
courses.description: Covers dynamics and control of mechanical systems. System modeling, time response, frequency response, and stability.

courses.title: Engineering Math: Differential Equations and Linear Algebra
courses.description: Introduction to linear algebra and ordinary differential equations for mechanical engineering, including numerical approaches to solving systems of equations.

courses.title: Introduction to Aerospace Engineering and Design
courses.description: Fundamental concepts of aerospace engineering through lectures on aeronautics, astronautics, and design. Student teams design, build, and fly radio-controlled lighter-than-air vehicles.

courses.title: Structural Mechanics
courses.description: Bending, shear, and torsion of thin-wall shell beams; buckling of columns and stability phenomena; introduction to structural dynamics; design of aerospace structures.

courses.title: Principles of Macroeconomics
courses.description: Introduction to macroeconomic analysis. Topics include national income, output, employment, money, interest rates, exchange rates, and economic growth.

courses.title: Entrepreneurial Finance
courses.description: Elements of entrepreneurial finance for technology-based start-up ventures. Covers valuation, funding, venture capital, and exit strategies.

courses.title: Financial Management
courses.description: Corporate finance and capital markets: valuation, risk management, derivatives, financing decisions, and dividend policy.

courses.title: Economic Analysis for Business Decisions
courses.description: Microeconomics for managers: market demand, pricing strategy, market power, and regulatory policies.

courses.title: Managing Innovation and Entrepreneurship
courses.description: Building organizations to bring technological innovations to market. Practices and processes for managing innovation effectively.

courses.title: Classics of Western Philosophy
courses.description: Introduces Western philosophical tradition through Plato, Aristotle, Descartes, Hume, and Kant. Topics include nature of mind, existence of God, and foundations of knowledge.

courses.title: Ancient Philosophy
courses.description: Study of ancient Greek philosophy including Socrates, Plato, and Aristotle. Examines ethics, metaphysics, and epistemology.

courses.title: Minds and Machines
courses.description: Introduction to philosophy of mind: consciousness, mental representation, personal identity, and artificial intelligence.

courses.title: Introduction to Literary Theory
courses.description: Introduction to major schools of literary theory including structuralism, psychoanalysis, Marxism, and postcolonialism.

courses.title: Studies in Literary History: Modernism
courses.description: Explores how literature, philosophy, and film respond to profound changes in world view marking the twentieth century. Nietzsche to Fellini.

courses.title: How to Stage a Revolution
courses.description: Comparative history of revolutions from the French Revolution through twentieth-century upheavals. Examines causes, dynamics, and outcomes.

courses.title: Introduction to Building Technology
courses.description: Introduction to building technology including structures, materials, and environmental control systems in architecture.

courses.title: Introduction to Urban Design and Development
courses.description: Introduction to the theory and practice of urban design. Examines how cities are shaped through planning, design, and development.

courses.title: User Interface Design and Implementation
courses.description: Principles and techniques for designing, implementing, and evaluating user interfaces. Topics include usability, interaction design, and prototyping.

courses.title: Software Construction
courses.description: Fundamental principles and techniques of software development: specification, design, implementation, testing, and debugging. Emphasis on correctness and maintainability.

courses.title: Computer Graphics
courses.description: Introduction to computer graphics: image synthesis, modeling, rendering, and animation. Topics include ray tracing, rasterization, and GPU programming.

courses.title: Algebra I
courses.description: Introduction to abstract algebra: groups, vector spaces, linear transformations, symmetry, and group actions.

courses.title: Introduction to Computers and Engineering Problem Solving
courses.description: Introduction to programming using Java with emphasis on engineering problem solving. Data structures, algorithms, and object-oriented programming.

courses.title: Transport Processes
courses.description: Fundamental concepts of fluid mechanics, heat transfer, and mass transfer in chemical engineering applications.

courses.title: Introduction to Anthropology
courses.description: Introduction to anthropology covering cultural, biological, archaeological, and linguistic perspectives on human diversity.

courses.title: Technology in American History
courses.description: History of technology in America from colonial times to the present. Explores the relationship between technology and society.

courses.title: Expository Writing
courses.description: Intensive practice in expository writing: developing ideas, organizing material, revising, and editing.

courses.title: Introduction to Geology
courses.description: Introduction to physical geology: Earth structure, plate tectonics, minerals, rocks, and geological processes.

courses.title: Introduction to Biological Engineering Design
courses.description: Introduction to biological engineering including synthetic biology, genetic engineering, and design principles.

courses.title: Introduction to Media Studies
courses.description: Introduction to media studies: critical analysis of media forms, technologies, and cultural practices.

courses.title: Introduction to Musical Composition
courses.description: Introduction to musical composition: exploring melody, harmony, rhythm, and form through composition exercises.

courses.title: Molecular Biology and Genetics in Modern Medicine
courses.description: Application of molecular biology and genetics to medical diagnosis and treatment. Topics include gene therapy and genetic diseases.

courses.title: How to Make (Almost) Anything
courses.description: Introduction to digital fabrication: 3D printing, laser cutting, CNC machining, and embedded programming. Making physical things with digital tools.

courses.title: Software Studio
courses.description: Software engineering principles and web application development. Design patterns, RESTful APIs, and modern development practices.

courses.title: Machine Vision
courses.description: Computer vision: image formation, segmentation, recognition, motion analysis, and 3D reconstruction.

courses.title: Automatic Speech Recognition
courses.description: Algorithms and systems for automatic speech recognition. Acoustic modeling, language modeling, and decoding.

courses.title: Information Theory
courses.description: Mathematical theory of information: entropy, data compression, channel capacity, and error-correcting codes.

courses.title: Introduction to Convex Optimization
courses.description: Convex sets, functions, and optimization problems. Applications to signal processing, machine learning, and control.

courses.title: Introduction to Neural Computation
courses.description: Mathematical models of neural computation: single neurons, neural networks, and learning algorithms.

courses.title: Multicore Programming Primer
courses.description: Introduction to multicore and parallel programming: threads, synchronization, and performance optimization.

courses.title: Chinese Foreign Policy
courses.description: Analysis of Chinese foreign policy from 1949 to present. Topics include grand strategy, security policy, and international relations.

courses.title: Cellular Neurobiology
courses.description: Introduction to structure and function of the nervous system. Cellular properties of neurons, synaptic transmission, and sensory systems.

courses.title: Cell and Molecular Neurobiology
courses.description: Major areas of cellular and molecular neurobiology: excitable membranes, synaptic transmission, neural plasticity, and neural development.

courses.title: New Enterprises
courses.description: How to start a new venture: opportunity identification, business models, team building, and financing.

courses.title: Numerical Computation for Mechanical Engineers
courses.description: Numerical methods for mechanical engineering: linear algebra, probability, statistics, ODE solving, and data fitting.

courses.title: Calculus Revisited: Complex Variables, Differential Equations, and Linear Algebra
courses.description: Video series covering complex variables, differential equations, and linear algebra. Originally released in 1972.

courses.title: Relativity
courses.description: Special relativity and introduction to general relativity. Lorentz transformations, relativistic mechanics, and Einstein field equations.

courses.title: Computational Models of Discourse
courses.description: Computational approaches to discourse: coherence, summarization, and dialogue systems.
